sentences: Ühel hetkel aeg ja ruum kadusid mu jaoks, olin väljaspool ruumi ja aega.
Võtke end koomale, mul ei ole siin ruumi.
context: The Estonian word 'ruum' has multiple related meanings. It can refer to physical space or room (as in a building), the concept of space and time as dimensions, an area or region, volume or capacity, and is also used as a clipping for 'ruumimeeter' (cubic meter). The word functions as both a countable noun (rooms) and uncountable noun (space/area), with various compound forms indicating different types of spaces.
